message: So i was reading this article http://kencochrane.net/blog/2011/06/djangozoom-com-review/ and it mentioned that Django Zoom, pulls from your repo.  Currently they only support git, but i can see this going to bitbucket and hg, which is why i use.  I guess my question is, why can't ep.io do that? instead of using git or hg to upload, why not just pull from my already existing repo on github or bitbucket?
there might be something i'm missing, but i feel that this would be faster ... my internet connection is sucky, from ep.io to bitbucket or github should theoretically be faster?
(it uses git in the background, but that's irrelevant)
you upload to ep.io with a command-line tool which is scm independent
@rasiel We are planning to have that, but pushing code up was the most wanted feature (for things like private repos), so we did that first.

Glad to hear this is planned - for cases where multiple people have the rights to deploy, it can be good to make it impossible to deploy except from a public (or private-but-shared) repo, so that you never hit the situation where someone deploys something but forgets to push it.
@kennethreitz You can also (already) deploy to ep.io directly with a git or hg push if you want, rather than "epio upload".
